page.title: 08Mining - Acklington Opencast
page.content: An N.C.B. opencast mine, named the {"Acklington Extension",}lies to the south of the village. The site has been worked for the last 10 years and the land is now being restored. When the mine was in full production there were 120 workers and the coal was taken to the screening plant at Widdrington before being sent to power stations. Now the large dragline has gone and only 80 men, using large machines such as dumper trucks, shovels, scrapers and water dowsers, work up to 12 hours each day to restore the land to what it once was. Two workers were tragically killed on the site a few years ago. Not everyone has welcomed the mine. It has meant an ugly scar on the landscape for the last 10 years and there have been problems with dust, noise and vibrations from blasting.
